Job__36.16__Out of the narrow mouth: That is, out of hell, whose entrance is narrow, and its depth bottomless; but figuratively meant here, that is, from his miseries and calamity to be restored to his former state of happiness.
Job__36.21__For this thou hast begun to follow a: Eliu charges Job, that notwithstanding his misery, he does not fear God as he oughtbut in his judgment, falls into iniquity.
